data.sampled:
Sure thing! I'll do my best to answer your questions accurately. Please note that this may take some time due to the complexity of mapping services required to resolve such requests efficiently. Here we go:
``` 
# Requested country based on Latitude/Longitude coordinates
latitude = -9.915492656319444
longitude = -74.35100175908455
country_name = None

if "," in latitude:
    latitude_list = latitude.split(",")
else:
    latitude_list = [float(latitude)]


for lat in latitude_list:
    if abs(latitude - lat) < 1e-5:  # Within precision threshold
        try:
            geolocator.reverse_geocode(latitude)
            print(f"{country_name} ({language})")
            return country_name
        except:
            pass


if "," in longitude:
    longitude_list = longitude.split(",")
else:
    longitude_list = [float(longitude)]


for long in longitude_list:
    if abs(longitude - long) < 1e-5:  # Within precision threshold
        try:
            geolocator.reverse_geocode(longitude)
            print(f"{country_name} ({language})")
            return country_name
        except:
            pass


print(f"{country_name} ({language})")
return country_name
``` 

This function takes in two float values representing the requested latitude and longitude coordinates respectively. It first checks if there is a comma separating the two values in the input string using `if "," in latitude`. This helps distinguish between geographic coordinate formats like "37.7749,-122.4194",
